checks.label: Duplicate payment verification
checks.detail: 184 high-confidence groups (£74.4K). Duplicate ratio: 0.9%. Filtered out: 10 batch payments, 1070 CSV overlaps.

checks.label: Split payment analysis
checks.detail: 2 suspect instances (£96.3K, 0.0% of spend). Threshold: 5+ payments to same supplier in same week, 80%+ of approval limit.

checks.label: Year-end spike verification
checks.detail: Highest spike: 5.7x in GOVN - Policy & Governance. Year-end spikes are common in public sector (capital programmes, grants). Only extreme spikes (>3x) warrant concern.

checks.label: CH compliance — pre-breach only
checks.detail: 7 suppliers have current breaches, but all payments were made before breaches started. Not violations at time of payment.

checks.label: Cross-council price comparison
checks.detail: 16 shared suppliers found. 2 with >200% price gap (requiring 3+ transactions each side). Extreme disparities (>10,000%) filtered as different service scopes.

checks.label: Benford's Law forensic screening
checks.detail: Significant deviation from Benford's Law (p < 0.001). χ²=476.6 on 18812 amounts >£100. Largest deviation: digit 5 (3.5% off expected).

warnings: 2 suppliers show >200% price disparity after filtering. These are more likely genuine value concerns than extreme outliers.

Benford's Law analysis shows significant deviation (χ²=476.6). Digit 5 deviates 3.5% from expected. This warrants investigation but can also occur with legitimate round-number grants or threshold-based payments.
